title: The biggest roster moves from all 32 NFL teams: How did each team get to 53 players?
content: With the 2025 season a week away, NFL teams were required to finalize their 53-man rosters. We rounded up every team's cuts here.

title: Mets 'punch back' again, stun Phils in walk-off win
content: The Mets' bats stayed hot Tuesday night, when they beat Phillies closer Jhoan Duran with four straight singles in a 6-5 walk-off win.

title: Cardinals' Contreras gets six-game ban, appeals
content: Willson Contreras was suspended for six games and fined an undisclosed amount for his tirade during the St. Louis Cardinals' 7-6 win over Pittsburgh Monday night, but he appealed the decision, allowing him to play on Tuesday in an 8-3 loss to the Pirates.

title: Mercury's Thomas breaks own triple-double record
content: Alyssa Thomas had 12 points, 16 rebounds and 15 assists for her WNBA single-season record seventh triple-double in the Mercury's win Tuesday night.

title: Gauff struggles with new serve, holds on for win
content: Coco Gauff struggled with her revamped serve Tuesday night but managed to hold on for a 6-4, 6-7 (2), 7-5 victory over Ajla Tomljanovic.

title: Sanders makes Browns roster, to open as QB3
content: The Browns trimmed their crowded quarterback room to Joe Flacco and rookies Dillon Gabriel and Shedeur Sanders and named Gabriel the backup to Flacco.

title: Schottenheimer says Parsons will need 'ramp-up'
content: Cowboys coach Brian Schottenheimer for the first time said Micah Parsons would likely need some ramp-up time when he eventually does return to play.

title: AL Cy Young contender Eovaldi likely done for '25
content: Rangers right-hander Nathan Eovaldi, among the favorites for the AL Cy Young Award, will likely miss the remainder of the season with a strained rotator cuff.

title: Texans' Ward put on commissioner exempt list
content: The NFL placed Texans starting safety Jimmie Ward on the commissioner exempt list, the league announced Tuesday.

title: ❤️ Sports world reacts to Kelce-Swift engagement
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end and pop star announced their engagement in a joint Instagram post on Tuesday.

title: How Travis Kelce has prepared for what could be his final season
content: Kelce, who announced his engagement to Taylor Swift on Tuesday, is ready for one more shot at Super Bowl glory.

title: 'End Game': Kelce, Swift announce engagement
content: He knelt to the ground and pulled out a ring. Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's love story has reached new heights.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: The MVP race heats up as Aces hold steady at No. 2
content: A'ja Wilson has led Las Vegas on an 11-game winning streak to clinch the league's second playoff spot.

title: Runaway MVPs, ROY races? Expert predictions for every major 2025-26 NBA award
content: Can Jokic claim a fourth MVP? Which rookie will impress? Our NBA Summer Forecast panel reveals its award predictions for the 2025-26 season.

title: Reranking every MLB farm system from 1 to 30
content: The busiest time of the year for adding prospects has passed. Here's how every organization stacks up now.

title: Bo Nix, Calvin Ridley among Eric Moody's top draft targets
content: Eric Moody lists the players he's most excited about drafting this season, including some late-round targets.

title: Trey Hendrickson is latest Bengals star to get paid; now they have to win
content: Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins and Hendrickson all landed new deals this offseason, and with that come expectations.

title: Predicting Keegan Bradley's final six Ryder Cup picks: Locks, guys on the bubble and maybe himself
content: Bradley will fill out his roster on Wednesday and the biggest question on everyone's mind is whether he'll be playing at Bethpage Black in September.

title: Premier League's most intriguing summer moves, from Cherki to Guessand
content: Given how much Premier League clubs spend these days, there are some curious moves under the surface that have major bust/boom potential. Let's review five of the most intriguing.

title: New USMNT roster a head-scratcher: Is Pochettino wasting a chance for World Cup prep?
content: The USMNT only has four more camps before the 2026 FIFA World Cup begins, but coach Mauricio Pochettino's latest roster feels like a wasted opportunity.

title: After skipping Gold Cup, Musah has big plans for USMNT in a World Cup year
content: United States international Yunus Musah speaks to James Olley about his his hopes for next year's World Cup hosts.

title: Osaka shares inspiration behind US Open first-round outfit, 'Billie Jean Bling' Labubu
content: The two-time champion entered the court Tuesday with sparkly red roses in her ponytail and a coordinating red outfit.

title: V of K-pop group BTS snaps photo with Shohei Ohtani, delivers Dodgers first pitch
content: V of K-pop sensation BTS threw a strike for the ceremonial first pitch before the Dodgers' game on Monday.

title: Way-Too-Early Bracketology: Is this (finally) the year of the Big Ten?
content: For a change, the Big Ten has both quantity and quality to send to the Dance. Can its 25-year title drought finally end?

title: College football betting: Breaking down the Heisman and national champion odds, top bets
content: Pamela Maldonado tracks the odds to win the Heisman Trophy and the national championship and shares bets that offer the best value.

title: The best 100 players in the NFL this season: Our experts' ranking, starting with four QBs in the top five
content: We predicted the top players in 2025. How many Eagles are ranked? Is Patrick Mahomes still No. 1? Where does Myles Garrett land?

title: Who were NFL Rank's 10 worst snubs? Scouts and execs ID the misses
content: Only 100 players can make the player rankings. Here are 10 more who league insiders felt should have been there.

title: Way-too-early UFC at the White House fight card
content: Dana White says a UFC event at the White House is "going to happen" in 2026, so let's take a early look at building a fight card fit for the venue.

title: Boxing divisional rankings:  Did Baraou's win land him in the junior middleweight top 10?
content: Abass Baraou and Yoenis Tellez put on a show during a slow boxing weekend. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Why Cadillac chose Bottas, Pérez (and not an American) for F1 seats
content: There won't be an American behind the wheel of Cadillac's F1 car, but in Sergio Pérez and Valtteri Bottas, there's plenty of race-winning experience.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Atlético eye Man United's Mainoo
content: Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid have joined the race for Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Fantasy baseball pickups: Power, speed and a must-add returning ace
content: Here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers returning from injury.

title: Twist In Noida Dowry Case, Nikki Bhati's Sister-In-Law Makes Big Allegation
content: The Noida dowry death case has taken a dramatic turn with fresh allegations surfacing against the victim's family.

title: Quadcopters, Modern Weapons: Pakistan's ISI's Tech Boost For Jaish-e-Mohammed
content: Pakistan's spy agency, the Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI), is actively engaged in upgrading the technological and military capacity of the terrorist outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM), sources told NDTV.

title: Odisha YouTuber Missing For 5 Days After Being Swept Away At Duduma Waterfall, Search On
content: A 22-year-old YouTuber from Odisha's Berhampur city has been missing for five days after he was swept away by the strong currents of the Duduma waterfall in Koraput district while shooting reels, police said on Wednesday.

title: India Issues Fresh Flood Alerts On 'Humanitarian Grounds' To Pakistan Over Tawi River Overflow
content: India has issued fresh alerts to Pakistan about the "high probability" of flooding in the Tawi river, with incessant rainfall in the northern states forcing the release of excess water from major dams, sources said on Wednesday.

title: Video: 7,500 Books Used To Make Ganesh Idol In Chennai
content: Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Devotees across Tamil Nadu thronged Ganesh temples with devotion and joy on the first day of the ten-day Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

title: Days After Noida Horror, Another UP Woman Burnt By Husband Over Dowry
content: Days after the brutal death of 26-year-old Nikki Bhati in Greater Noida, another case of dowry-linked violence has emerged in Uttar Pradesh.

title: Kerala Teacher Charged For Asking Muslim Students To Avoid Onam Celebrations
content: A teacher at a private school in Thrissur district of Kerala has been charged for allegedly making "communal remarks" by advising students to refrain from taking part in Onam celebrations.

title: Video: Man Beaten With Bat In Hyderabad Road Rage, Case Against AIMIM Leader
content: An AIMIM ward member and two others have been charged for allegedly assaulting a man, with a cricket bat, during a road rage incident in Hyderabad.

title: On Camera, 16-Year-Old Hits Man With Car, Drags Body For 600 Metres In Delhi
content: A 32-year-old man was hit and dragged for 600 meters by a car in Delhi. Behind the wheel was a 16-year-old student, who has now been detained, and the car has been seized.

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi Rides Royal Enfield In Bihar Rally, Sister Priyanka Sits Behind Him
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and RJD's Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday rode motorcycles as they made their way through the streets of Bihar's Muzaffarpur district during the ongoing 'Voter Adhikar Yatra'.

title: "If You Have The Guts...": BJP's Big Bihar Challenge To MK Stalin
content: A political storm has erupted over Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin's visit to Bihar, where elections are due this year-end, with the BJP raking up the controversy over the "anti-Bihar" and "anti-Sanatana" remarks made by DMK leaders in the past.

title: Video: Popular Manali Restaurant Swept Away In Flood, Only 1 Wall Remains
content: Sher-e-Punjab, a well-known restaurant in Himachal Pradesh's Manali, has been completely destroyed after severe flooding hit the area, leaving only its front wall standing.

title: After Supreme Court Order, Delhi Launches Sterilisation Drive For Stray Dogs
content: The Delhi government will launch a sterilisation and vaccination drive campaign under the Animal Birth Control (ABC) Rules 2023 after the Supreme Court orders on stray dogs.

title: Couple Speaks Out After Bride's Vidaai Cab-Booking Video Goes Viral
content: Days after a video showing a bride booking a cab during her vidaai ceremony - departure from her parents' home - went viral, the couple has responded to the outrage the clip caused on the Internet.

title: Video: Army Chopper Rescues 22 CRPF Personnel Stranded Due To Punjab Floods
content: The Indian Army Aviation on Wednesday conducted a daring rescue operation near Madhopur Headworks in Punjab's Pathankot district, saving 22 CRPF personnel and three civilians who were stranded due to rising floodwaters.

title: Trump's 50% Tariffs Will Set Back India-US Ties, Says NATO Advisor
content: The latest US tariffs on Indian imports will be a setback for the relationship between Washington and New Delhi-- built painstakingly over the past two decades of bipartisan efforts, including during President Donald Trump's own first term.

title: Trump Says He's Prepared For Fight Over Cook's Ouster From Fed
content: President Donald Trump said he was prepared for a legal fight with Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook after he moved to oust her from her post following allegations that she falsified mortgage documents.

title: Reuters Journalist Quits, Cites "Deep Shame" Over "Betrayal" In Gaza
content: A Canadian photojournalist has quit Reuters, accusing the news agency of "enabling" Israeli attacks on journalists in Gaza.

title: Microsoft Asked FBI Help Track Palestinian Protests, Some Employees Escaped
content: For the better part of a year, Microsoft Corp. has failed to quell a small but persistent revolt by employees bent on forcing the company to sever business ties with Israel over its war in Gaza.

title: An 83-Year-Old Pizza Tycoon Jack Cowin Fights to Save 3,500 Domino's
content: Billionaire Jack Cowin built a fast-food empire by bringing fried chicken to 1960s Australia. Now, at 83, he's back to attempt a turnaround of the biggest Domino's Pizza franchisee outside the US.

title: Noida 'dowry death': How did Nikki die? Police to quiz sister Kanchan again
content: Noida police are re-examining Nikki Bhati's sister, Kanchan, amid conflicting claims surrounding Nikki's death. New CCTV footage and a video purportedly recorded by Kanchan have surfaced, prompting investigators to verify statements and establish the sequence of events. Nikki's family alleges dowry harassment, while Vipin's family claims a cylinder blast caused the fatal burns.

title: 'Not his style to negotiate over phone': PM Modi avoided four Trump calls, says report
content: Amid escalating trade tensions, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reportedly declined multiple calls from US President Donald Trump, signaling a strain in relations. This comes as Trump claimed to have averted a nuclear war between India and Pakistan, a claim widely disputed.

title: ‘Clear message to terror masterminds’: Amit Shah honours soldiers of Operation Mahadev
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the soldiers involved in Operation Mahadev, which neutralized three terrorists linked to the Pahalgam attack. Shah emphasized that Operations Sindoor and Mahadev delivered a strong message to terror masterminds about the repercussions of harming Indian citizens.

title: ‘Country first, commerce later’: Indian refiners unlikely to stop Russia oil trade
content: Despite US tariffs, Indian refineries are maintaining Russian oil imports, prioritizing national interests in ongoing trade discussions. Government officials and industry executives suggest India is firm in its stance, believing that conceding on oil could invite further demands.

title: PM Modi to be in China after 7 yrs; Xi to host over 20 world leaders including Putin
content: President Xi Jinping is set to host over 20 world leaders, including Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi, at the SCO summit in Tianjin, signaling Global South solidarity. PM Modi's visit marks a significant step towards easing tensions with China after border clashes.

title: 'ChatGPT responsible for our son's suicide': Parents of 16-year-old sue OpenAI, Sam Altman
content: The parents of Adam Raine, a 16-year-old boy, are suing OpenAI and CEO Sam Altman, alleging that ChatGPT provided their son with instructions and encouragement related to suicide. The lawsuit claims the chatbot validated Adam's suicidal thoughts, offered specific details on lethal methods, and guided him on obtaining alcohol.

title: R Ashwin's last IPL wicket was 14-year-old teenager - Watch
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, the veteran Indian off-spinner, has retired from the IPL after a 16-year career, announcing his decision shortly after retiring from international cricket. His final IPL appearance was with CSK in 2025, marking a return after a decade. Ashwin's last wicket was notably that of 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, whom he praised for his impressive batting skills.

title: Delhi car horror: 16-year-old driver drags man 600m to death; flees fearing mob attack
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi, a 32-year-old factory worker died after being hit and dragged by a car driven by a 16-year-old. CCTV footage helped police identify and detain the minor, who claimed he panicked after the accident. The victim was dragged nearly 600 meters, and a case of culpable homicide has been registered.

title: J&K rain fury: 31 dead as massive landslide buries Vaishno Devi pilgrims
content: Torrential rains have devastated Jammu and Kashmir, causing widespread landslides and flash floods that have claimed at least 31 lives. The Vaishno Devi pilgrimage has been suspended following a deadly landslide, and transportation networks are severely disrupted with train cancellations and highway closures.

title: '200 Chinese planes were unable to fly': Trump warns Beijing; tariff war continues
content: Donald Trump threatened China with 200% tariffs if rare-earth magnet exports are curbed, jeopardizing the trade truce. Trump claimed the U.S. leverage includes withholding Boeing parts, grounding Chinese planes. China's magnet exports to the U.S. surged recently. A Chinese analyst dismissed Trump's remarks as a bluff.

title: Kerala HC grants anticipatory bail to rapper Vedan in rape case
content: The Kerala High Court has granted anticipatory bail to rapper Hirandas Murali, known as Vedan, in a rape case. The court acknowledged the seriousness of the charges but determined that custodial interrogation was unnecessary. A woman doctor accused Vedan of sexual harassment and engaging in a sexual relationship under the false promise of marriage between 2021 and 2023.

title: 'Confidence is growing': Pakistan coach issues warning as Shaheen Afridi nears top gear
content: Pakistan's bowling coach, Ashley Noffke, assures that Shaheen Afridi is regaining his top form before the Asia Cup, after battling a back injury in 2023. Afridi's pace is improving, with more balls reaching 140km/h during the West Indies series. He is working on his technique and swing to challenge the stumps consistently, aiming to hit speeds close to 150km/h.

title: Mark Zuckerberg’s Meta planning to spend $50 billion on AI data center: Donald Trump
content: During a cabinet meeting, US President Donald Trump announced Meta's plan to invest $50 billion in a new AI data center, potentially the world's largest. While Meta hasn't confirmed the exact figure, the facility will support ambitious AI initiatives, including the Superintelligence Labs division.

title: Maori All Black Shane Christie dies at 39; tragedy reignites concussion debate
content: New Zealand rugby is mourning the sudden death of Shane Christie, 39, a former Highlanders flanker and Māori All Black. His career was cut short by repeated concussions, leading to struggles with headaches and memory loss. Christie became an advocate for concussion awareness, joining the Billy Guyton Foundation and pledging his brain for research.

title: Journalists killed in Gaza: India expresses shock over loss of lives
content: India has voiced its shock and deep regret over the recent killings of journalists in Gaza's Khan Younis due to Israeli strikes, emphasizing its consistent condemnation of civilian casualties in conflict situations. The Israeli authorities have initiated an investigation into the incidents, which included an airstrike on a hospital that resulted in the deaths of several individuals, including reporters from prominent news organizations.

title: 'Can't wait to see you': Wife Prithi pens note as R Ashwin bids farewell to IPL
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, the veteran Indian off-spinner, has announced his retirement from the IPL after a remarkable 16-season career, expressing gratitude to the franchises and BCCI. While stepping away from the IPL, Ashwin confirmed his continued participation in overseas leagues, marking a new chapter in his cricketing journey.

title: Incessant rains batter J&K: Road connecting Tawi Bridge washes away as river swells
content: Jammu and Kashmir are facing severe consequences from relentless monsoon rains, leading to infrastructure damage and a landslide near the Vaishno Devi shrine, tragically resulting in at least 30 fatalities. A viral video captured the dramatic collapse of a road connecting the fourth Tawi Bridge, while rising river levels prompted widespread evacuations and disrupted transportation services, necessitating extensive rescue operations by various agencies.

title: 'New beginning': R Ashwin announces IPL retirement; will play other leagues
content: Veteran Indian off-spinner R Ashwin has announced his retirement from the Indian Premier League (IPL), expressing his desire to explore opportunities in other global leagues. Ashwin, who previously retired from international cricket, thanked the IPL and BCCI for their support.

title: US' 50% tariffs in effect: India prepares multi-pronged strategy to shield economy
content: India faces significant export challenges as the US imposes a 50% tariff on $48.2 billion worth of Indian goods, effective Wednesday. Labour-intensive sectors like textiles and seafood are expected to be severely impacted, prompting manufacturing suspensions. The government is exploring support measures, including an Export Promotion Mission and GST restructuring, while continuing trade negotiations with the US.

title: 'Told very terrific man PM Modi … ': Trump reiterates tariff forced India-Pak ceasefire
content: Donald Trump stated he stopped a nuclear war between India and Pakistan. He threatened India with high tariffs. Trump claimed Narendra Modi was involved. He said both sides backed down after his intervention. India has denied any third-party involvement. Rajnath Singh said the ceasefire was India's decision. Narendra Modi and other ministers have refuted Trump's claims.

title: Close shave for 22 CRPF jawans, civilians: Building collapses shortly after rescue
content: The Indian Army rescued 22 CRPF personnel and three civilians stranded in a building near Madhopur Headworks in Pathankot, Punjab, before it collapsed due to heavy flooding. Continuous downpours in Jammu and Kashmir caused waterlogging and flash floods, disrupting transport links and stranding tourists.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Best Vinayaka Chaturthi wishes & messages for your loved ones
content: Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Celebrate Vinayaka Chaturthi on August 27, and spread joy by forwarding these heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to your loved ones.

title: Ex-West Coast Eagles star Mitch Brown comes out as bisexual
content: Mitch Brown, former West Coast Eagles player, revealed he is bisexual. He is the first male AFL player to do so. Brown cited homophobia as a reason for early retirement. He hopes his announcement will help other players. Izak Rankine was suspended for a homophobic slur. Brown urges AFL to promote inclusivity.

title: Rahul Fazilpuriya murder plot: 5 shooters held in Gurgaon after encounter
content: In a joint operation, STF and Gurgaon Crime Branch apprehended five shooters plotting to murder Bollywood singer Rahul Fazilpuriya, suspected in the earlier killing of his friend Rohit Shaukeen. Acting on intelligence about gangsters Deepak Nandal and Rohit Sirdhania's plan, police laid a trap.

title: Cricket: Justin Langer undermines Rishabh Pant's Gabba heroics: 'It was flat'
content: Justin Langer downplayed Rishabh Pant's match-winning innings at the Gabba in 2021, which secured India's Border-Gavaskar Trophy victory. While he initially praised Pant's fearlessness, Langer now suggests the flat pitch and COVID-affected circumstances diminished Australia's home advantage. He highlighted that playing in January differed from the usual November conditions, impacting the game.

title: ‘Somebody is not very happy’: Fiji PM Rabuka backs India amid 50% US tariffs
content: Fijian Prime Minister Sitiveni Rabuka expressed confidence in PM Modi's ability to navigate challenges following the U.S.'s imposition of tariffs on Indian goods. During his New Delhi visit, Rabuka met with PM Modi, President Murmu, and participated in discussions, highlighting the strong diplomatic ties between Fiji and India.

title: Meet Lalit Patidar: The Indian teen who suffers from the werewolf syndrome
content: Lalit Patidar, an 18-year-old from India, has earned a Guinness World Record for having the world's hairiest face, with 95% coverage and a density of 201.72 hair strands per square centimeter. Diagnosed with hypertrichosis, or "werewolf syndrome," Lalit initially faced social stigma but has since embraced his unique appearance.

title: With Pujara’s retirement, have we seen the last of the Test specialists?
content: With performances in the IPL being considered even for Test selection, one feels the era of single format players, who prioritise only the five-day version, may be over.

title: Most expensive celebrity rings: Where does Taylor Swift rank on the dazzling diamond list?
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce announced their engagement. Swift's ring is valued at $550,000. Other celebrity engagement rings are also highlighted. Scarlett Johansson's ring cost $450,000. Georgina Rodriguez's ring is worth $5 million. Kate Middleton's sapphire ring is iconic. Lauren Sánchez's pink diamond is valued up to $5 million. Amal Clooney's ring cost $750,000.

title: 'Hit a million subs, cut your hair': Michael Jordan dares Kai Cenat; bold challenge after Mafiathon 2
content: Twitch streamer Kai Cenat is gearing up for Mafiathon 3 with a high-stakes dare from actor Michael B. Jordan. Jordan challenged Cenat to cut his signature hairstyle if he reaches one million subscribers during the 30-day event, starting September 1, 2025. Cenat initially hesitated but ultimately accepted the challenge, adding excitement to the upcoming stream.

title: Delhi-Leh flights disrupted: IGI airport issues travel advisory due to bad weather
content: Flight operations between Delhi and Leh faced disruptions on Wednesday as adverse weather conditions impacted the Ladakh region. Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL) issued an advisory, stating they are collaborating with stakeholders to lessen passenger inconvenience. Passengers are advised to check with their airlines for the most current flight status and updates.

title: Mumbai to Konkan in 5 hrs: Rs 2500 RoRo ferry starts Sept 1; Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg on route
content: Ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi, the Maharashtra government will launch RoRo ferry services from Bhaucha Dhakka to Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg starting September 1, weather permitting. This South Asia's fastest ferry service, cutting travel time from 10-12 hours by road to just 3-5.5 hours.

title: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone face legal heat over faulty car endorsement: Report
content: Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone are entangled in a legal issue alongside Hyundai officials, following an FIR in Rajasthan. A lawyer alleges her Hyundai Alcazar had serious defects despite promises of a problem-free vehicle. She claims repeated malfunctions endangered her family. The FIR names Hyundai executives and accuses Khan and Padukone of promoting defective vehicles as brand ambassadors.

title: Nasa alert! Massive asteroid 2025 PM2 set to close flyby Earth at 41,000 mph today
content: Asteroid 2025 PM2, about 190 feet in diameter, will pass Earth at a distance of 2.31 million miles on August 27, 2025. While not a threat, this close encounter allows scientists to study near-Earth objects and refine planetary defense strategies. Continuous monitoring is crucial for understanding orbital dynamics and potential hazards, as highlighted by ISRO's plans to study larger asteroids.

title: FIFA-AFC puts India on notice; AIFF must adopt constitution by Oct 30 or face suspension
content: The AIFF faces a potential suspension from FIFA and AFC if it fails to ratify its constitution by October 30. A joint letter from the governing bodies expresses concern over the continued delays and legal uncertainties surrounding the constitution's finalisation. FIFA and AFC demand a definitive order from the Supreme Court approving the revised constitution to avoid sanctions.

title: 'Give pistols, not gold in kanyadaan': UP mahapanchayat after Noida 'dowry killing'
content: Following a dowry-related murder in Greater Noida, a 'mahapanchayat' in Baghpat has controversially urged parents to gift daughters weapons like pistols and swords during 'kanyadaan' instead of traditional dowry. The gathering, largely attended by Rajputs, cited concerns over women's safety and the ineffectiveness of dowries.

title: Assault by bouncers? Actor-politician TVK chief Vijay booked
content: Actor-politician Thalapathy Vijay, chief of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), faces legal trouble as Kunnam police register a case against him and his bouncers following an alleged assault complaint by Sarathkumar. This development occurs as Vijay intensifies his political efforts, aiming to challenge the DMK in the upcoming 2026 assembly elections, positioning TVK as a strong contender in Tamil Nadu politics.

title: Virar building collapse: 2 dead, 8 injured, several feared trapped
content: In Virar East, a section of Ramabai Apartment collapsed overnight, resulting in at least two fatalities and eight injuries. Rescue teams are on-site, working to free several individuals feared trapped under the debris. The collapse occurred during a birthday celebration, prompting the evacuation of the remaining building wing as authorities assess the damage and continue rescue operations.

title: India to begin testing new long-range interceptor missiles for defence shield next year
content: India is set to begin testing indigenous interceptor missiles next year under Project Kusha, a key component of Mission Sudarshan Chakra. The project aims to create a multi-layered air and missile defense shield by 2035, rivaling systems like the S-400. Development includes long-range surface-to-air missiles with ranges from 150-km to 350-km, with integration of various technologies for comprehensive defense.

title: Focus on Quad as PM Modi heads to Japan; US reaffirms commitment to Quad
content: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri emphasized Quad's role in Indo-Pacific peace and development as PM Modi prepares to visit Japan. The US and India reaffirmed their commitment to a secure Indo-Pacific through Quad. Modi and Ishiba will discuss Quad cooperation, aiming to upgrade security cooperation and boost defense ties, while Japan plans a $68 billion investment in India.

title: J&K flash floods: Landslide near Vaishno Devi shrine kills 30 — Top developments
content: Heavy rains triggered a devastating landslide near the Vaishno Devi shrine in Jammu and Kashmir, resulting in the tragic loss of at least 30 lives. The disaster prompted the suspension of the Vaishno Devi yatra and the cancellation of numerous train services. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah briefed the Union Home Minister on the situation and is closely monitoring relief efforts.

title: SC Collegium proposes transfer of 14 judges across nine High Courts
content: A similar reshuffle had happened in the High Courts in May, days after Chief Justice Gavai took over as top judge

title: Bengal Governor removes Gour Banga University's V-C over dereliction of duty, corruption charges
content: The Governor’s directive came days after the university’s inspector of colleges accused the professor of demanding money to cover legal expenses

title: IMD issues red alert for heavy rains for three districts of Himachal Pradesh
content: Red alert for Chamba, Kangra, and Mandi districts; road connectivity between Mandi and Kullu remains affected as both the main highway and alternate routes are blocked

title: BJP demands ‘SIR’ within GHMC limits before local body polls
content: BJP leader Marri Shashidhar Reddy called for strict action against those who have registered in Hyderabad as voters despite belonging to other constituencies or states

title: Armed forces must be prepared for longer conflicts: Rajnath Singh
content: In an address at the ‘Ran Samvad’ at the Army War College in Mhow, Madhya Pradesh, Rajnath Singh said India does not want anyone’s land, but it is ready to go to any extent to protect its territorial integrity

title: CSIR-CCMB scientists discover novel way to expedite tissue repair and regeneration
content: The study has overturned the long-held belief that once a cell begins to die, its journey is irreversible

title: Modi-made ‘MEGA’ has become ‘MAHA headache’ for India: Congress on additional U.S. tariffs
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications, Jairam Ramesh, said the "Trump double tariff" has come into effect, which will undoubtedly hit India's labour-intensive exports to the U.S.

title: Additional 25% tariff imposed by U.S. President Trump on India comes into effect
content: Earlier, PM Modi asserted he can’t compromise on the interests of farmers, cattle-rearers, small-scale industries, cautioning “pressure on us may increase, but we will bear it”

title: Watch: Why did the government ban money-games online?
content: The Union Government has brought in a law to ban online games played with money. This is a heavy blow, to the industry that has attracted huge sums as investment, running to billions of dollars and which is said to employ a couple of lakhs of people. Why did the government bring this about?

title: SC to hear journalist's plea against Assam Police FIR over video post on August 28
content: In his plea, Mr. Sharma has challenged the validity of Section 152 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), which deals with acts endangering the sovereignty, unity and integrity of India

title: Killing of journalists in Gaza shocking: India
content: Five journalists were among at least 20 people killed in the strikes on Nasser hospital in Khan Younis

title: SpiceJet imposes 5-year flying ban on Army officer who assaulted its staff at Srinagar airport
content: The officer has been banned from taking any domestic, international or non-scheduled flights operated by the airline during this period

title: Trump again claims he stopped India-Pakistan war from ‘going nuclear’
content: The U.S. President’s latest comments came on August 26 during a cabinet meeting at the White House, where he also claimed that he had spoken with Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Rains relentlessly pound J&K; rescue operation underway in landslide and flash flood-hit areas
content: A massive damage has been reported to public infrastructure, including several key bridges, houses and commercial establishments

title: Congress blames Modi government’s ‘superficial’ foreign policy as U.S. tariffs take effect | LIVE
content: The Indian government is pushing a ‘Swadeshi’ mantra to reduce the economy’s reliance on exports, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi calling on Indians to be “vocal for local”

title: With Sci-Hub gone, will the ‘One Nation, One Subscription’ scheme step up?
content: Internationally, publishers such as Elsevier and Wiley have used the courtroom to buttress the legitimacy of their business model and portray shadow libraries like Alexandra Elbakyan’s Sci-Hub as rogue actors rather than as symptoms of dysfunction

title: Spice trade spurred shipping, colonialism, capitalism; created today’s Mumbai and New York: Nicholas Nugent
content: A journalist and map archivist tells many a fascinating tale of the spice age and its impact on the world through the centuries, pieced together from ancient maps

title: Two dead, nine injured as part of building collapses in Maharashtra’s Palghar district
content: The rear portion of the four-storey Ramabai Apartment, located on Narangi Road in Vasai, crashed onto a chawl in the vicinity around 12.05 a.m., said an official

title: Police issue strict guidelines for Ganesh festival in central zone
content: Security arrangements include the installation of CCTV cameras and measures to prevent thefts, particularly during night hours

title: Indian Army rescues stranded CRPF personnel, civilians near Madhopur Headworks as heavy rains batter Punjab
content: The flood-situation has turned grim in Punjab after the water levels in Sutlej, Beas and Ravi rivers and seasonal rivulets rose following heavy rains in their catchment areas in Himachal Pradesh and Jammu and Kashmir

title: 'Somebody is not very happy with you': Fiji PM Rabuka to Modi on U.S. tariff row
content: I told him the other day, somebody is not very happy with you, but then you are big enough to weather those discomforts, Mr. Rabuka said

title: Ahead of COP30, Mumbai’s Vasai-Virar faces mounting climate risks as urbanisation intensifies
content: Rapid development, wetland loss, flooding, and rising temperatures place the twin city among Maharashtra’s most climate-vulnerable regions, local mapping and global projections show.

title: State government’s invite is an opportunity to fulfil vow to Chamundeshwari Devi, says Banu Mushtaq
content: Active politicians should have a sense of what to politicise and what not to, says the Booker Prize winner

title: Why Ganesh Chaturthi is more than modak: Exploring Maharashtra’s culinary traditions, rituals and recipes
content: From Malvani pangats to Goan khatkhate and nivagrya born of leftovers, Ganesh Chaturthi in Goa and Maharashtra is as much about culinary diversity and nostalgia memory as it is about devotion

title: What was Tamil Nadu’s historic 1967 Assembly election like?
content: It was momentous as the DMK, a non-Congress party, rode to power for the first time in Tamil Nadu post-Independence. Bakthavatsalam remains the last Congress Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu

title: Remembering Vijayakant’s grand political debut in Tamil Nadu
content: At a press conference in Chennai on June 1, 2005, the Tamil actor promised to unveil his party’s name and ideology at the first State conference. On September 14, 2005, during the conference in Madurai, Vijayakant unveiled his party name – Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam – and its flag.

title: Delhi High Court asks Election Commission of India to consider political party’s plea for common symbol for Bihar polls
content: The Akhil Bharatiya Jan Sangh party claimed it was established in 1951 and was renamed in 1979, and has been contesting elections throughout its existence, besides applying from time to time for the election symbol from the ECI in line with the relevant laws

title: Suvendu alleges TMC MLA arrest in school recruitment scam only tip of the iceberg
content: Leader of Opposition accused that corruption runs deeper in the Trinamool Congress, Jiban Krisha Saha’s arrest only ‘surface of scam’

title: MANUU students condemn FIR against student leader
content: They alleged that cases against him was an attempt to silence Muslim student voices that are critical of the ruling dispensation

title: Dancing Ganesh micro sculpture on an eyelash tip
content: The micro-sculpture of Lord Ganesh dancing on eyelash which is completely invisible to the naked eye, requiring a microscope to view

title: Half of pregnant, lactating women in Bhubaneswar slums use smokeless tobacco on waking
content: Researchers warn SLT use during pregnancy heightens the risks, like preterm births, stillbirth, babies with low birth weight, and small for gestational age.

title: Meeting on FMR, Myanmar border fencing inconclusive
content: An 11-member delegation from three Naga organisations of Manipur held a meeting with officials of the Ministry of Home Affairs in New Delhi on August 26

title: CM calls for collective efforts to achieve ‘Developed Rajasthan-2047’ goals

title: CCMB’s seminal work on programmed cell revival offers hope for regenerative medicine
content: Programmed cell death is generally considered as an irreversible process, however, in recent years, researchers have found evidence that some forms of cell death can indeed be reversed under certain conditions

title: Maratha quota stir: Bombay HC says no protest at Azad Maidan without permission
content: Activist vows to begin an indefinite hunger strike in Mumbai from August 29, demanding 10% Maratha reservation under the OBC category

title: Two more persons held in gold heist case in Arani
content: Surrounded by buildings including a rice mill, the jewellery showroom does not have security personnel.

title: India, U.S. move to enhance defence partnership
content: The two sides reaffirmed their commitment to promoting a safer, stronger, and more prosperous Indo-Pacific region through the QUAD

title: IDSFFK 2025: ‘Rewritten’, an honest retelling of generational damsels and their self-salvation
content: Rewritten by Yara Naisam looks at a young woman’s understanding of her mother that reveals parts of her own psyche

title: IDSFFK 2025: Greeshma Kuthar and Manju Priya K, creators of ‘Namathu Chinnam?’, on cultural capital in Tamil Nadu during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections
content: The 51-minute documentary, shot across Tamil Nadu, explores the intentional emphasis given to certain art-forms practised by dominant communities, tokenisation of women and establishment of local icons in the state

title: Railways’ Bengaluru Airport link plan set aside as metro, suburban lines take shape
content: In February, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw had announced the plan as part of a wider push to decongest Bengaluru

title: Centre issues new guidelines for transfusion of animal blood
content: Establishment of State-regulated veterinary blood banks with biosafety standards and mandatory blood typing and cross-matching to prevent incompatibility are the key highlights of the guidelines

title: Supreme Court asks why judiciary can’t review inaction of Governors on bills
content: “If the discretion exercised by a Governor under Article 356 of the Constitution can be judicially reviewed, why not the discretion under Article 200?” Chief Justice Gavai responds to a submission made by the State of Maharashtra about the “wide” discretionary powers of Governors

title: Environment Ministry finalises National Designated Authority to kickstart carbon markets
content: Within the Paris Agreement, a section called Article 6 defines the contours under which such an emissions trading regime, or a market, can take shape; Article 6 was passed at COP29 in Baku last year

title: VIT observes World Entrepreneurs’ Day
content: The event also featured a MoU exchange between Audix Technologies and Tenet Technotronics (Bangalore) paving the way for collaborative innovation and industry–academia partnership.

title: Landslip: traffic banned on Wayanad Ghat Road
content: Soil, boulders, and trees have blocked the road near the 9th hairpin bend, making commute impossible

title: Greater Bengaluru Authority constituted with 75 members, Maheshwar Rao named GBA Commissioner

title: Catch up on NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves
content:
C.J. Stroud joins "First Take" to discuss how the Texans' offensive line has improved as a unit to protect him better in the 2025 NFL season. (1:13) The roster  cut-down deadline  for all  32 teams  for the  2025 NFL season  has passed. Each front office had to trim its active roster to 53 players by 4 p.m. ET, which means there were plenty of cuts, trades, practice squad additions and  roster moves  announced. Good news: We tracked it all for you. Here is the intel, including notable moves and what our reporters heard. There will be no more updates. Quick links: 
 Team-by-team list of cuts 
 Depth charts  |  Trade tracker  |  Trade grades 
 Fantasy football draft guide  |  Sign up to play
